Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
The Canon Pixma iP2702 is as basic and entry-level a photo printer as you're likely to find. The simple design consists of a paper feed tray at the top and two function buttons.
There isn't any fancy touchscreen control panels or any other means of connecting to your laptop other than a single USB connection.
Maintaining the minimalist approach to design, you'll find there is no capture tray at the bottom, with your finished prints simply rolling out on to the desktop.
The printer has two inkwells, one for black and a second for colour, and are accessed by lifting up the top of the printer. Once you've inserted the ink cartridges you'll find setting up is incredibly easy.
Easy installation
We found the drivers self-installed on both Windows Vista and ... Windows 7 with no problems, which means you'll be able to start printing straightaway.
When it comes to print speeds, you'll find the Pixma iP2702 is capable of printing up to seven pages a minute in black and white, and a little over four pages per minute in full colour.
However, for this test we wanted to check out photo printing capabilities and a standard 4 x 6-inch glossy took just under a minute, which is acceptable.
Image quality is also more than acceptable, considering there is only one colour inkwell. This means you won't find the full depth of colours as found on more dedicated printers, but for the cost we felt quality was above average.
The printer may indeed be cheap, but you will find cartridge prices will add to the overall running costs. A black ink cartridge, on average, costs £12 (inc. VAT), while we found colour cost £15 (inc. VAT) per cartridge. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
The Canon Pixma iP2702 is a colour inkjet printer at a rock-bottom price of just £36.
Few areas of IT offer such a diverse range of models as the inkjet printer market. At the top end the meatiest page churners cost hundreds of pounds, and go head-to-head with heavyweight lasers.
And at the other end of the scale you have, well, this price-crunching model from Canon. The Canon Pixma iP2702 is yours for just £36 – hunt around and you might even get one for around £30. So is there such a thing as too cheap? Well, that depends exactly how you intend to use the Canon Pixma iP2702.
Initial impressions are positive. At first glance the Canon Pixma iP2702 shows few signs of its lowly upbringing, and its smart black casing is elegantly curved. There aren’t many buttons to pla ... y around with, although that lack of potential clutter does help enhance the Canon Pixma iP2702’s looks.
However, there is an obvious gap in the front of the Canon Pixma iP2702. And that brings us to one of the Canon Pixma iP2702’s flaws – there isn’t an output tray. Not only does this make the Canon Pixma iP2702 look unfinished (as though you’ve forgotten to attach a vital part) but, more significantly, it’s a nuisance practically.
You’ll either need something to catch the sheets in, or else you’ll want to leave plenty of space on the desk in front of the Canon Pixma iP2702. Neither of these solutions are particularly desirable, and it seems a shame Canon couldn’t have just added a couple of extra pounds to the price and supplied a proper output tray.
Otherwise, the Canon Pixma iP2702 is a simple but undemanding USB printer. Given the price you won’t be surprised to find a dearth of special features – so no memory-card slot, LCD panel or wireless networking here. And the Canon Pixma iP2702 offers just printing – no scanning or copying facilities.
However, the software bundle (which includes Easy-PhotoPrint EX) is decent, and the Canon Pixma iP2702 works well. The page feed mechanism seems robust and reliable, and you wouldn’t necessarily expect that given the rock-bottom price tag.
It’s not a quiet printer though, and the loud clonk that accompanies a new sheet of paper being fed into the printer could prove very disconcerting for those sensitive about noise levels.
The Canon Pixma iP2702’s quoted figures may sound rather low – and it’s certainly true that this is no speed demon – but part of the ‘problem’ stems from Canon’s use of the demanding ESAT tests while calculating pages per minute.
In reality, the Canon Pixma iP2702 actually exceeded the quoted speeds while printing mono text – 8.2ppm rather than 7ppm. This may seem to put it a long way behind the 13.6ppm of the £50 Epson Stylus SX415, but even in the fastest mode the Canon Pixma iP2702’s text is dark and reasonably clear – the Epson’s, in contrast, is unacceptably faint.
In some respects, the Canon Pixma iP2702’s fastest text mode is actually the best for quality. The text is thicker and darker in the standard and high quality modes, but this seems to exaggerate the slightly fuzzy definition of the lettering.
The output looks good when held at arm’s length however, and the speed of 6ppm in standard mode (1.9ppm in highest quality) is actually pretty good – the Epson can only put out decent text at a speed of 4.1ppm. Provided you’re not producing documents requiring close analysis, this actually works quite well as a text printer.
Colour prints are fairly attractive, although the output is a little too faint. The fastest mode produces very palatable pics at a speed of 3.9ppm. The only real drawback in this mode is that the images look slightly foggy.
The standard mode sees speed almost halve - to 2ppm – and isn’t quite as packed with colour as we’d like. And the 0.7ppm highest quality mode isn’t significantly better. Photo paper images are pleasing though, and this printer will be adequate for running off camera snaps. The running costs (which, with high-capacity cartridges, work out at 3.7p for mono... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: There's no doubt you can get good quality print from the PIXMA iP2702. There's also little doubt that it's a basic device, a bit pricey to run and one which should come with a set of ear defenders. It's about time printer makers considered noise levels, along with the looks and features, of their machines. Canon has an enviable reputation for inkjet printers and all-in-ones and its printer range starts at under £50. The PIXMA iP2702 is an upgrade to the PIXMA iP2600, the main differences being the ink cartridges and software bundle, plus an external case redesign. The design of the printer is clean and unfussy. A textured black top surface rises to a smooth plateau, formed by the gloss black back of the paper tray. This tray lifts up to reveal paper guides for A4 sheets, though the machine ... can also print on sizes down to 15 x 10cm. /e37d15|There's no output tray and printed pages feed out to the desktop, which can be awkward if it has a smooth surface, as sheets tend to float and not collect in a neat stack. There are two control buttons, each with inset LEDs, set into the right-hand end of the top panel, one for power and the other for paper feed and error conditions. The only sockets at the rear are for mains power and USB data connection – there's no network support either wired or wireless on this machine. The mains cable plugs straight into the printer, though, without a separate power supply. Only HP still feels the need to have power 'bricks' kicking around under the desk. The top and front covers hinge up as one to provide access to the twin ink cartridges; when you lift the cover, the head carrier slides into a convenient position, so you can clip them in. /1a5d80|Canon provides basic but useful support software with the PIXMA iP2702. This includes the Easy-Photo Print and Easy-Web Print utilities, with the latter providing organised printing of Web pages and components of them. Easy Photo-Fix II is also included, for automatic fixes to common photo problems. Drivers are available for all versions of Windows from 2000 right through to Windows 7 and for OSX from 10.4.11. There's no explicit support for Linux. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 3 out of 3 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: * Quality print * Quality photo prints (I compared a print from Target, the image quality came out nicer. The colors were more natural and smoother. The photo paper that came was even better than what was printed from Target.) * Quick print * Price * Light
Cons: * Loud power on, power off, and printing * No tray * Expensive ink, yet not. These are what everyone has been saying, but for the price and the quality of the print. These can't be used to deduct eggs, as most owners reviewed the similar. I said the inks are expensive it's because reference to this printer, I can buy another printer while this printer still costs ~$35. If it was over, then I wouldn't think it would be expensive as long as it lasts long.
* Can't tell how long each ink cartrid ... ge will last I bought this printer to replace a broken HP All-In-One. This is a temporary replacement. From all the reviews I've read and also because I wanted a photo printer, I chose this. Although it is a cheap photo printer lacking a lot of quick functionality on the machine, it is worth it. I don't need to use USB or SD cards to print out from. I rather do it on the computer since bigger screen and easier to choose images from. So all those functionality doesn't apply to me. For those who carry the printer, thi sis very light. ;) But I guess not portable like those very expensive JUST photo printers. I would recommend this printer to anyone regardless of the ink. It's really not that bad, if the quality of this printer is good. I was tired of HP too. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Great Overall Quality; Easy Setup; Reliable; Accurate Colors; Sharp Tones & Colors; Great Contrast; Fast Print Time
This is a great printer. I got it on sale and it was by far the cheapest printer that I have seen in quite some time. However it was very easy to set up and works great. Ink cartridges are not that cheap but then again ink is not cheap for any printer. Great value for a great printer

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact, beautiful, super quality for the low price, creates amazingly great photos and is really stingy on ink usage. I love the fact that it comes with full size ink cartridges and that the software and printed documentation that ships with this is so detailed and informative.
Cons: Will not print from a memory card.
This replaced a 2 year old Canon IP2600 that had performed flawlessly the entire time I owned it. I praised the older model to everyone I knew, saying it was hands down the best compact printer available and well worth the price. I gave that one to my step mom because at $23 with 2 day shipping, the recent IP2702 deal Newegg offered was too great to pass up. It amazes me that Canon can build such quality and performance into a budget printer. I have ... owned other brands of printers but found Canon to be far superior, this little miracle trumps the performance of a competing brand I had before that cost 3X as much, and uses less ink to boot. Why can't all electronics come with the excellent printed owners manuals that Canon provides? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Just what I was looking for.
Item.Review:
Pros: Great print quality on all types of print jobs, especially considering the price paid. Low price. Very easy to set up and operate. Fairly fast. No paper exit tray - my space doesn't have room for one.
Cons: Noisy. Clunks and clanks, and the so-called "Quiet Mode" doesn't seem to make much difference. Quiter than an impact printer, but noiser than many inkjets.
The first thing I was looking for was size; I needed one to fit in a particular space. I was also looking for the cheapest printer that would handle basic printing needs, and have been pleasantly surprised by the quality of all printing, from quick text jobs to glossy photos. I know the price of the ink cartridges will eventually make up for the low purchase price, but I like the fact that each cartri ... dge has its own nozzle system. Also, other reviewers have indicated that the cartridges tend to last quite a while. As for durability and reliability, only time will tell. It isn't exactly built like a tank, but it looks like it should hang together for a good long time if it isn't abused or dropped. I gave it 5 Eggs because, for the price, it exceeds my expectations. If it were a pricier unit, I would probably downrate it some for the noise. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: This printer was super cheap, easy to set up with my mac, prints black and white quickly, and I was quite impressed with the photo printing. It also includes a small photo paper sampler (which when you only use it occasionally, as I do, can last quite awhile).
Cons: The black and white text is very slightly fuzzy, but certainly fine for my purposes, and it's possible aligning the print heads or something would improve it as well. I've heard ink can be pricey, but haven't had to replace it yet.
I just need a printer for occasionally printing forms or photos, and this is amazingly cheap and high quality.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: As an Administrative Sgt. I purchase these for use in our police vehicles. They are holding up very well compared to the more expense compact printers that we have used in the past. For $29.00, you can't beat the price and durability.
Cons: These printers are large and loud. Kinda hard to find a place to mount it in a car. Haven't used it for photo printing so i can't tell you about the quality.
I highly recommend these printers.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: I needed a printer and just a printer. This one does great job of printing B&W as well as color, and I get good pictures. Plain & simple. That's all I wanted and it's what I got. Easy to setup; easy to use; and the price is just right!

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: Good choice if you want a small footprint printer for general use. Easy to use and set-up. Very good quality printing. Of course, the ink is expensive and proprietary so even though this printer is a bargain, you'll be spending multiples of the printer cost on ink over time.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: I was looking for a simple photo printer to use for sharing pictures with friends and relatives. I chose this printer, and am in no way disappointed! It is easy to use, and makes great prints. I couldn't be happier.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent little printer for a little price, if that's what you need. It fits the role admirably and there's no "Catch-22" beyond the obvious limitations.
Cons: No tray to catch the print-outs. That's really my only complaint. At this price, I'm willing to find an ad hoc solution to the problem without deducting an "egg."
I see many people complaining about the noise - well, there's a setting for this printer, "Quiet Mode," that would help you out. It also has "Power Off" (auto-off) and "Auto Power" (auto-on) functions that work even over a network, making it quite convenient for printing in a small network setting. I only used the driver and none of the Canon software, and all of its functions were still available through Windows. I also see people complaining that i ... t doesn't come with a USB cable. No printer I have ever purchased has; I recommend you buy one online (I won't list the place to get them to avoid breaking review guidelines, but they're super cheap compared to store prices). The ink is actually pretty affordable compared to most printers, and you can purchase it directly from the vendor for a respectable price, although like all printers it goes through the color quite rapidly. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Does the job & does it well. Not sure how long the ink lasts & what cartridges cost. Outperforms my HP Inkjet Photo R200 (7 cartridges!) in all aspects including premium color prints
Cons: Bulky, load, and about a minute from power on to print, but who can complain at the price. Does not come with USB cable, but there again, for the price....

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Photo specialized Good Printer programing Quiet, fast Photo printed quailty, like you get when ordering prints from a store. I tested with the same Cannon paper, and printed the same Photo from both my printers. My other printer is a good printer also. There was no comparison, PIXMA was better.
Cons: No Paper catch tray, not a huge con I knew it didn't come with a USB cable, would be easier if it did. But then I got this on Sale for $19.99 plus delivery. If it's to get me to buy thier Photo paper and inks.. it's working. The INK's are not high priced, and told long lasting. The paper looks like professional quality, and also not hi priced.
I have had many different printers over the years. This is my first Cannon. Wow am I impressed. 4X6 photo paper r ... uns through no problem and the Print Quality is the best I have ever printed. Photos look, and feels like bought at the store prints. This printer has 3 pages of align settings, an ok thing. The quality is worhth it. This is a second connected printer. I got it for Photo's not documents. It can print anything. There is no catch tray, but big deal, the table gets it. And buying a USB cable is cheap. If you don't have one around, you'll need one. The supplied software is very good and easy to use. I also printed quality with my Corel Photo software, with no problems. I recommend this awesome printer, even as a 2nd attached printer for Photo's like I am doing. Now, I know I can print store quality Photo's. Even if you don't need a new printer, get this one for Photo's. It's awesome. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: First of all, when you buy this printer, you do NOT get the USB cable, so unless you already have one, there is this added expense. There is also NO TRAY to catch the printed pages, which I consider very cheap. The quality of the photo printing is of sub-standard quality. The documents seem to print OK. On the photo printing, even though I am using gloss photo paper, it looks like it is being printed on regular typing paper. I went into the adjustment page, and tried many many different adjustments, and ALL of them were of sub-standard quality. It was as if the photos had a "Milky like" appearance. I guess I should have known, you get what you pay for. I will definitely be returning this printer. If you want to print good quality photos, this is NOT the printer for you!
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Very good print quality great photos good print documents. Great price. photo paper sample included.
Cons: no usb cable included would have been 5 eggs with cable.
great everyday printer for any job.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Everythign I could want for the price
Item.Review:
Pros: Cheapest printer on newegg at the time Satisfactory print quality Good speed for simple printing Does photos nicely Good drivers, many maintenance functions Comes with full-size ink cartridges Looks nice packaged well(all the parts that might bang around are held down with non-marring tape) Came with sample pack(5 sheets) of photo paper Cartridges are not DRM-locked or otherwise crippled (I'm looking at you HP and Kodak.)
Cons: New ink cartridges cost as much as the printer. But you can get a set of both refurbished for less than $30 if you search.
Not a big deal, but doesn't come with a USB cable
Manual INSISTS you ABSOLUTELY have to install the software on the disk before even connecting the printer. I have windows 7 32-bit and this w ... as completely false for me- the driver on the disk was older than the windows-included one! The other software is STRICTLY OPTIONAL.
Newegg got this to me in three days. How in the heck!
Completely satisfied. It spits out plain text pages like you would not believe, and when I cranked it up to high and used the sample photo paper I was delighted by the quality. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Canon PIXMA IP2702 Colour Printer (4800x1200dpi resolution, Borderless Printing)
Item.Review: Good Points: Worked straight from the box. Easy to set-up. Very good print quality for the price. Cartridges are not as expensive as some printers. Overall good value for money if you don't need pristine quality prints. Bad Points: USB connection only, no wireless but probably a bit more reliable for that point and if you don't need wireless, it isn't worth the extra price. No USB cable included.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: - Fast printing on the Speed setting. - Easy setup out of the box. - Excellent basic printer for the price.
Cons: - Takes around 30-45s of preparation time before the first print job. - A little louder than most inkjets I've had.
A Lexmark printer I had finally broke down, I needed another printer to print schoolwork from, and this was it.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Price. The thing is dirt cheap. It's print quality from the few photo's and a couple of black and white test pages I printed looked perfect. Setup was prety much plug and play in Win7.
Cons: Dosn't come with a USB cable. I knew that going in, so I bought one and had it shipped the same day. Got the printer on I think Tuesday, and the cable came Wednesday. Went to plug it in, and I got the wrong USB cable :-( It's my fault, so no reason to take off an egg. See other thoughts.
Make sure you order whats called an "A Male to B Male" USB cable. There are several different kinds of USB cables, and it can be a little confusing. I went specifically with this.
BYTECC 3 ft. Type A Male to Type B Male Cable Model USB2-3AB-K
That worked perfectly.
If ... you just need a cheap home printer for normal use, don't hesitate to buy this one. I think you'll like it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Very good price. Prints quickly. Color printing. Good instructions on how to install and prep the printer.
Cons: No print out catch tray. No USB2 to USB 1.1 cable.
I'm not sure how much ink is but it might be cheaper to buy another one of these printers.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price! Windows 7 setup was automatic and flawless. Print quality is good and plenty fast for a home printer.
Cons: Given the sub thirty dollar cost, it's are hard to find any faults. I'll be happy if it runs long enough to exhaust the ink cartridges, which I suspect it will.
I guess I was a bit disappointed it has no printed sheet catch tray but it sits on a desk and paper just drops in a stack in front of the printer. I really wanted to give a rating of say 4.75 eggs, because of no tray but why quibble? For what it cost, it's very high value indeed. Getting ready to print it's a bit noisy - don't use it in church. Construction is definitely not heavy duty - don't use it as a football.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Comes with a print cartridge which usually cost more than this whole unit...
Cons: If you are looking for something fancy then dont buy this. Doesn't come with USB cable but is cheaper (see below)
HINT1: If you run out of ink, buy a new printer for less money HINT2: look for the combination deal that comes with the usb cord and it will be about 2 dollars cheaper than the original price PLUS you get your usb cable...

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: Brilliant value for money. My boyfriend installed this for me very easily and the quality of printing is very good. It does make a slight noise but as I use it for personal rather than business use this really isn't a problem. Fully recommend this as an excellant buy

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: gOOD QUALITY PICTURES. EASY INSTALL.
Cons: NONE
I bought 2 of these. $25 each. Used for pictures only. Yeah it did not come with USB cable. Big deal; just bought them at the Dollar store. One connected to Dell Desktop and one to an HP desktop, both with Windows 7. Istalled just fine, no problems. Yes the ink is a little pricey, yes there is no tray, yes no USB cable provided...SO WHAT! These work great for me, if it's a problem for you just take your printing to the chinamart or something. I'm real happy and the people I give prints to are pleased.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Reasonable price and prints as well as many more expensive printers.
Cons: You just need to make provisions for catching the paper as it exits the printer or you'll be picking it off the floor.
When I say I learned my lesson. No more expensive printers for me. A printer like this one is satisfactory for my needs and it won't hurt as much when I scrap it.
I will be bidding good bye to my Canon iP4200 and I have many worthless ink cartridges.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: Great for printing color and black & white out put on paper. Will do photos also but is not intended to be a top quality photo printer. However for the point and shoot photographer it works quite well.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Copier of my life, where had you been!
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time; Easy To Use; Great Overall Quality; Reliable; Great Contrast; Easy Setup; Accurate Colors; Sharp Tones & Colors
I have used this copier for all my personal and some business printing. It has not failed me yet. I have tried the picture setting and the picture quality is awesome. After much searching and money wasting on other brands, this one has been the pill for my past headaches! Thanks!

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Best Printer to buy, it print real good picture same or better than the one in the photo lab. It make little noise dont know why people complain about. Is fast and easy to use!!!
Cons: None, should have got it soon
Better than any printer out there!!!
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Good quality, sharp colour, little noisy
Item.Review:
Pros: Produces very crisp, images in color and b+w. Text printing good quality, though slightly slower than a standard printer.
Cons: Printing head moves with speed so leads to some noise and potential shaking of unit if not placed in a stable position

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: PRICE, PRICE, PRICE. Also, it works quite well as a photo printer. It produces good quality photos, which was the only reason I bought it - I haven't done any b/w or text of any kind.
Cons: Windows software seems to work as well or better than the canon software when printing photos, which was surprising. The internal machinery is a little noisy with it's clicks and clacks, but is easily put up with for the price and quality.
Buy one, I don't think you'll be disappointed. NewEgg shipping was fast and the printer arrived without incident.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Good value. Print quality is very good. Our Canons generally beat HP, Lexmark, Koidak, and Dell printers for reliability.
Cons: Not conservative on ink, and the next set of color and black/white ink costs nearly double the cost of the printer. Has a tendency to make a lot of noise in resetting after your print job is over.
Ours has been reliable, and without problems in operation

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: The price of the printer's cheaper than the ink to refill it! Good quality on each print, and the printer itself is very, very lightweight.
Cons: The price of the printer's cheaper than the ink to refill it?

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: I was surprised by the quality of the printer. It does make noise, but theres a "quiet mode", which print slightly more slowly and make significantly less noise. I always use it on this quiet mode and it doesn't wake up anyone. There is no paper tray, but there's and extendable tongue which does the job. Ink cartridge are also relatively affordable. Since I don't use it often, I like how everything can be closed, so no dust get's in. Works very well with Windows 7 64
Cons: You need to provide your own A male to B male USB 2.0 cable.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: - Produces consistently outstanding print, photos, and specialty deliverables which can last many years - Generally good printing speed and quality at default settings - Works out of the box with any Win7 machine connected to the Internet
Cons: - Makes a loud clunking sound for several seconds when engaging. I've seen 1,000-page-per-hour copy machines which made less noise than this thing. - As many others stated, the OEM ink costs MORE than the printer itself. When the ink runs dry, the printer is donated to the local DAV charity (yes, they know it has no ink when they get it) and I buy a new one. Does this make sense? No. Will I keep buying printers that cost half what the cartridges cost? Yes. Sigh.
Order a USB A-style cable, since the printer doesn't come w ... ith one. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Quick setup on Windows 7 64-bit Professional. No USB is included, but it was not a problem because I used the cable from my old printer that I was replacing. I put it to work quickly by printing out 200 Pages of PDF files from an internet class as well as a few 4x6 photos with the photo paper included. The duplex printing was nice for paper reduction, and it says I still have 100% of the color ink and 80% of the black ink left, so it seems the ink will last awhile.
Cons: The way I have my work area setup, a paper tray was a must have for my printer, and something I overlooked. I ended up putting the printer on the floor for the mass print job, but for most small jobs I will have to get used to catching the paper as it comes out.
Another thing I liked was I did not have ... any double feeding paper. My previous printer (HP psc 1315) would constantly double feed paper, and it was very frustrating and made duplex printing impossible. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: I bought this item for printing cd/dvd labels. I am more than satisfied. I just wanted a plain printer not one of those all-in-one things. The printing quality is very nice and a lot better than an hp was using before. It is a quality printer at a greater price. Worth every penny. Two minor inconveniences are that there is no paper tray for output and no usb for connecting to the computer.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Good machine, can recommend to students
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy Setup; Fast Print Time; Easy To Use; Reliable; Great Overall Quality
Cons: Noisy; Pricey Ink Replacement
I use this printer mainly for b/w document printing. I am not crazy about color photo printing. One good thing I noticed: Paper guide that my previous one did not have. The paper guide is very useful when printing envelopes. This printer is noisy: therefore I use this in the daytime.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: Prints great photos for the price. I just needed something to be able to print school papers and some photo's with and this did the trick perfectly. It's small, prints pretty fast, and the end product is great.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Printer Goes through Ink fast
Item.Review:
Pros: Great printer. Quick setup and prints BEAUTIFULLY !!
Cons: Ink doesn't last too long and costs about as much as the printer..
I wish that HP and Cannon would stop giving away printers just to sell the ink. Can't they just provide a quality product and stop trying to rob us blind on ink forever. It's getting to the point that we should just buy printers and throw them away when the ink runs dry.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: -Very easy to set up. Just remove tape insert cartridges and install software. Oh yeah and plug into outlet and PC. -Photos look great. They send a sample pack of glossy 4x6 photo paper. (make sure you use photo setting) -Prints plenty fast enough unless you plan on printing massive amounts of sheets at a time. -Software is easy to understand
Cons: Didn't come with a cable but you have to expect that with most printers nowadays.
I've been printing photos and my wife has been printing a lot of coupons and we have had no problems yet. We got this to replace a laser printer we inherited from our old business that was taking up way too much space.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Good simple printer for the price- can't beat it. Installed quickly and easily.
Cons: It doesn't come with a tray to catch the printed paper. I have it sitting on a shelf so it falls on the floor after printing. Not a huge deal though, would work fine sitting on a desk!

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: I have bought three of these here when the price drops to 30 bones w/f/ship. This printer works great!!!
Cons: Not loud enough to drown out my wife's nagging.
Could be louder, but I usually go to my girlfirends house to get away from the torture.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Good print quality. Optional software. Fairly pretty. Unbeatable price. Canon quality hardware.
Cons: Low capacity, expensive ink (9 mL and 15 mL). Fairly loud.
For a clean install, I recommend only installing the latest driver and MyPrinter software available on Canon's website.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Works with Linux, albeit barely (see more below).
I use it for printing scientific papers, so I need the color for charts and plots. For this, it is excellent. I haven't printed any photos, so I can't comment on that.
It comes with a power cable (integrated power supply) and two ink cartridges. I have no idea if the cartridges are full or starters.
Setup was a breeze. Remove all of the tape, insert the cartridges, insert power cable, plug in USB, and hit the power button and I was done. There's no need to open the manual on this one.
Cons: This printer is so close to having a native 64-bit Linux driver (instructions below). Canon, why didn't you step up to the plate and finish it?
It doesn't come with a USB cable (you'll need to get an A-to-B cable) ... .
It works in Linux. You'll need to search Google for either "ip2700 rpm" or "ip2700 deb", depending on your system. The driver comes from Canon Asia and is only 32-bit, sort of. The current version, as of my writing this, is v3.30. On my 64-bit system, I had to force install the 32-bit version of libpopt0, then install the 32-bit printer driver rpms (there are two in the downloaded tar-ball). Then copy the files from /usr/lib/cups to /usr/lib/cups64 and then I could use the printer.
It's no louder than any other inkjet I've used. It seems reasonably fast. The print quality is great for my needs. The printer itself is normal sized, although I was expecting it to be smaller from the pictures.
Dimensions: 5" tall 17.5" wide 9.75" deep (although you'll need a bit more room for the paper output) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Cheap and good for printing black and white shipping labels. Easy to set up.
Cons: No usb cable.
I got this to print black and white USPS shipping labels for a certain online auction site and I'm very happy with it for that.
They claim it's for printing photos, but I don't think I'd have been happy if I'd bought it for that.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Low price and free shipping. Acceptable print quality for a low-end/entry level printer.
Cons: It is NOISY .......... very noisy.
When the ink cartridges need replacement, it would be cheaper to buy a new printer rather than buying the ink.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: I use the printer for basic text printing and it's pretty good. With only two cartriages, I'm probably not going to use it for photos, though. Just wish it came with a cable to connect to my computer.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Does everything well - fast sharp printing. The price is truly great but then again customers have come to expect this type of exceptional value from Newegg.
Cons: Can be a bit of an ink hog but nothing too serious
Cheap bast....... is my hero of reviewers!! Cons, other thoughts absolutely hilarious!!!!

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Ordered this as gift for friend (out of state), So this is a guess rating in the middle.
Cons: This was given as a gift for friend in another state, so guess a mid rating if fair.
Friend needed decent monitor and a printer, so prices fit my low income.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: it prints perfect labels, drivers install automatically and there is no bloatware. ready to print literally 2 minutes after you plug it in
Cons: its loud, its picky about paper, it takes forever to print, dont use it to print photos, they will look like trash.
i bought this printer for my business to print black and white shipping labels. it prints them, and it does it for next to no cost which looks good on a spreadsheet full of business expenditures. thank you Canon

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: inexpensive, good for people who have that magic touch of destroying every thing they touch, throw it out and buy a new one.
Cons: too inexpensive, people won't buy it, they think something it wrong with it.
It seems that people are buying these when on sale, removing the ink cartridges from the box, then reselling the printer on ee bay with out the ink.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: had it for 6 months, no problems at all. bought this for the same price as ink for my old printer. works great with windows 7.can't say the same for my fairly new HP printer.
Cons: no paper tray to catch the prints,they just fall on the floor.
The great new egg deals with free shipping make it possible to just buy a new printer everytime you run out of ink.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: A bit noisy but at the end of the day it is a budget printer....very good printing at a cheap price..does what it says on the tin..very good value for money printer..

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Gets the job done on the cheap
Item.Review:
Pros: Dirt cheap. Comes with cartridges for black and color ink. Can install basic driver without full on software, and can be easily removed if need be.
Cons: It's loud as hell, slow as hell, it doesn't come with a USB cable, it feels cheap and chintzy, and it doesn't have a tray for printed pages to rest on. But these are all trivial things. The thing prints.
I needed a printer for college, and it gets the job done. I can't complain at such a ridiculously low price. If you're smart, you can dodge official inks and get refill kits or off brand cartridges online, since ink for cheap printers is prohibitively expensive officially. Also, any USB Type-B cable will work with this. You probably have one lying around your house somewhere.
It's also worth noting that for tech ... heads who don't like to bloat their PC down with crapware, you don't to install any for the printer to work. Just a very basic driver. I already tried uninstalling it to see how easy it was, and it easily uninstalled in its entirety. I cant say the same for my old Epson which required me to edit my registry to remove the drivers. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: prints really sharp, looked great
Cons: no catch tray replacement ink more expensive than printer itself
Got it for less than priced now (6/5/12), and gotta say, it's as good as my Dell printer minus the scanning ability, that was around $80.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: Relative to the money this printer is good value. I hope it will be as reliable as the Canon all-in-one we have. I bought the iP2702 for our daughter to use at college, to print papers rather than photos, mainly. Her report: There's no USB cable in the box, so use one you already have, or you have to buy one for the printer. After just 1 week, the ink that came with the printer ran out. I'm thinking Canon cut another cost by providing an extra tiny amount of ink in the box. However, the printer doesn't take up much room and does what it needs to: it prints well.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Overall Quality; Easy To Use; Easy Setup; Fast Print Time; Reliable
Cons: Too much ink used; Large Footprint; Photo Prints not useable; Noisy
This printer do not print color photos well at all, it took a lot of tweaking the setting to get any keepers. It does print black and white photos, documents and school papers great at a very fast speed.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: It prints a really good picture. Better than expected for a throw away printer.
Cons: Got what I wanted for the price I wanted so null in this instance.
At these prices why would I buy ink? It's more to buy ink than a new printer. Makes a great printer for the kids to play with.
I'm rating at 5 eggs for a printer of it's price range. Better than most printers in that range.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Cheap.
Cons: Not recognized reliably by Windows 7 64-bit, no catch tray
I'm about to RMA this thing. Every time I want to print I have to uninstall this printer and all of the drivers. Then, I reinstall drivers and boot the computer with the USB plugged in. Then, I turn on the printer and cross my fingers. I bought it as an ad hoc machine to use IF I needed to print, otherwise it would have already gone back. I figure its not the cable since it works sometimes. I don't know. Don't buy this printer unless you've got some spare time and a little aspirin. None of the forums are giving me answers so, back it goes!

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: I will buy this product again.
Item.Review:
Pros: Sharp Tones & Colors; Reliable; Easy Setup; Accurate Colors; Great Contrast; Fast Print Time; Great Overall Quality; Easy To Use
Cons: Too much ink used; Pricey Ink Replacement
Arrive on time as promised.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Prints a very nice photo. Works on my Trendnet print server. Was free with Acer monitor with free shipping.
Cons: I am sure the ink will cost too much.
Installed flawlessly on Windows 7 64 bit.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: It's a cheap printer... cheaper than buying replacement cartridges, which means that I will probably just buy a new one and donate this one when the ink runs out. Works right out of the box with an internet connection.
Cons: A bit loud, but cheap enough to offset that slight con. The hardest part about setting it up was trying to remember what I did with my old usb cable as this one does not come with one.
Just what I was hoping for. Works well and it's practically disposable.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Simple low budget printer for occasional use.
Cons: None for the price
The printer cable is never included, this not a con! And it costs around $2, not $20.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: this printer works good, just remove the protective orange tape (cool color), and load the black and color ink cartridges, not hard to do, btw, the manual is quite ok. Install the cd software, nice stuff, and during install, you are asked to connect the printer to pc, and after to turn on the printer, then install is quick to complete, and printing is not hard to do.
Cons: no cons.
Recommended printer, yes. btw, the included free picture sheets, 5 if i count right/ ha, are of ok quality. this is a good printer. i would buy it again.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Good quality printing Very cheap
Cons: Ink is more expensive than the printer!
This printer works well, but it's actually cheaper to buy a new one than it is to buy replacement OEM ink cartridges. It's no secret that printer manufacturers take a loss on the printer itself to sell you insanely overpriced ink. My normal Canon printer's color ink costs over $6,000 per gallon when I calculated it out. You probably wouldn't use that much ink in a lifetime unless you're running a print shop but the point is, printer ink is one of the most overpriced substances on Earth and Canon, HP, Epson etc are making a fortune selling it to you.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: It's been years since I've used a printer in my home, gave up using my Dell 3-in-1 after fighting with and paying for ink all the time. The Canon is a lot easier and friendlier to handle. Pictures print very nicely. Happy I made the purchase

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Sharp Tones & Colors; Great Overall Quality; Accurate Colors; Reliable; Great Contrast; Easy Setup; Fast Print Time
Very Satisfied with purchase, does what I need it to do.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Good value Print quality looks good with my casual use [I don't print photos just greeting cards]
Cons: USB conflict - external USB hard drives and thumb drives won't work WHEN THE PRINTER IS TURNED ON. TURN PRINTER OFF AND THEY WORK FINE. Probably uses lots of Ink but I plan to manually refill cartridges
I left the printer on so it would be ready when needed. USB hard drives and thumb drives suddenly weren't recognized: "unknown device" and "not working properly" type error messages. I researched and tried numerous fixes including uninstalling the USB controllers in device manager. Nothing worked. Then I noticed I'd left the printer on from the last printing job. I turned it off before starting the PC [XP Pro SP3] and all the drives that wouldn't work with prin ... ter on worked OK with it off. Without this problem, I give it a 5; If this problem was not easily resolved by turning the printer off, I give it a 1 since losing USB function is a big deal. The easy fix, once known, gives my compromise 3 rating. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: As good as an inkjet printer can be
Item.Review:
Pros: Pretty quiet. Prints as well as any inkjet I've ever used. Typical use is printing black and white text documents, so I cannot speak for photo print abilities.
Cons: None.
If you want a high end printer, this is not what you are looking for. This printer is ideal for students or occassional document printing. I wouldn't use it for high quality or high quantity printing.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Cheap and works great.
Cons: None for me. See "Other Thoughts"
I must be powered up every time it looses power. I use it in my work truck to print invoices. Inverter shuts off with ignition. Switch on printer is not a normal on/off switch. It's more like the switch on your desktop where it tells the thing to start up.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: I bought this printer for shop use to print diagrams and text. I needed it to be small and didn't want a multifunction unit. That's hard to find nowadays. This fit my needs. It prints very quickly. It requires less desk space than most printers. It doesn't require a lot of software although it's available on the CD included.
Cons: It's not quiet but that not an issue in my loud shop and it has no paper exit tray. It needs to be placed on the desktop otherwise the paper falls to the floor.
A perfect printer for my needs. Quick and easy installation in less than 20 minutes.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: It prints
Cons: Drinks ink at an alarming rate.
This is my second Cannon printer and both consumed ink at alarming rates. Never got more than 30 color pages before cartridge was empty. Cheap to buy,but the ink will put you in the poorhouse.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
I have had several printers over the years and I don't use them too much so the heads get clogged. I decided not to spend too much on my next printer. All I usually print is web stuff and occasional letters, resume or a pic. My sister got the same one to print photos for her jewelry business
This Canon is great! 1st- It is sharp and the images are clean and crisp. 2nd- The software makes it very simple to crop web pages. It is very easy to get exactly what you want. 3rd- The Photos are clear and the colors are good.
I buy a lot of stuff. I don't usually write reviews. I am impressed enough to write this one.
Great Printer! Great Software! Great Price!

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: inexpensive, it prints i was not prepared for how loud this thing is, and this isnt really a con, it could be a pro: it keeps me awake at work and scares the snoring guy in the cubicle next to me, couldnt have asked for more!
Cons: none
none

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: I bought it when it was on sale, for its price its a great little printer, it looks great, the top holds down nicely and flat, and it prints clearly from what I can see so far. Haven't been using it too often yet, so not sure yet of its longevity, but for what it was and how much I bought it for, I am quite satisfied!
Cons: Didn't come with a USB cable, but when I bought it I got one for free in a combo (sadly the combo is no longer available it seems). Doesn't come with any starter paper, and no paper tray on the bottom, so when you print it just shoots out your pages, all pretty minor stuff, and doesn't really take away from the deal!
I almost ended up returning the printer when it wouldn't print ink on paper . . . until I found out there are these little plastic tabs ... on the cartridges that have to be removed before you can print with it . . . D'OH!
Also, not sure how much ink cartridges will cost when my starters finally do run out, hoping its not too expensive to replace them, otherwise it might just be worth it to buy another printer entirely! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: easy set up, decent print quality
Cons: nothing
Here's my problem with this printer: It came free with a PC i bought five years ago. It's just a basic, el-cheapo printer. That outlasted the computer it came with! We've had a mac for three years, switching this to the Mac was a breeze, but I want a new printer! I'd like something bigger with more features, but I just can't rationalize the expense until this one dies. This thing's five years old, been through two moves, gets abused by my kid, and STILL keeps printing pictures, coupons, and crochet patterns with great clarity and precision. Stupid Canon!

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: I love simple things. Truly.
Plugged it into my MacMini running 10.6.5.
It fired up Software Update (it will come just wait). Asked me to download the drivers.
Installed.
Printed.
Thank you 21st century!
Cons: No USB A to B cable.
Leggings aren't pants.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: prints faster than i expected, good quality print
Cons: usb jack isn't included
does the job for a decent price(i got it for free with the emachines monitor)

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: It was free with my Acer 23.6" monitor, it works, comes with free photo paper
Cons: Expensive to buy ink for, loud, can't really complain because it was free
If considering to buy this printer, keep in mind that this is one of the very most basic printers available on newegg right now. It doesn't have a built in scanner or copier, and no wifi. It also has a tri-color ink cartridge, meaning that 3 colors are in one cartridge, and if one dies, you have to replace the entire cartridge even if the other two colors are full. Cartridges themselves are also expensive.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Canon PIXMA IP2702 Ink Jet Printer
Item.Review: Good Points: Excellent printer - very easy to set up and print quality is very good - would strongly recommend Bad Points: A bit noisy but that's only being picky!

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: I'm not a printing maniac but for my basic printing needs this gets the job done. Relatively fast for such a cheap printer. I got it free with the purchase of my Acer X233HZ monitor so I can't complain. I also spilled an entire glass of water on it the day I received it and it works perfectly fine. Printer drivers didn't suck immensely like some other brands.
Cons: Takes awhile to start up, but for my purposes this is no big deal.
Haven't tried printing photos yet so I can't comment on that.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: great printer easy setup looks great fast and quality is good best printer you could buy for this price hands down
Cons: some say the noise is load but i didn't think it was a problem at all definitely not for this price that's for sure
great deal, am completely satisfied

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: It was free with the purchase of my quad core Phenom
Cons: NONE
I already had a printer so I donated this to a person in college that needed a new printer.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy Setup; Great Contrast; Accurate Colors; Fast Print Time; Sharp Tones & Colors; Easy To Use; Reliable; Great Overall Quality
Buisness ans Pleasure

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Cheap price Nice printing quality
Cons: Ink is expensive
I uses this printer to print out both photo and documents. And i am happy with it.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Great Overall Quality; Sharp Tones & Colors; Great Contrast; Fast Print Time; Accurate Colors; Easy Setup; Easy To Use
EASY, SIMPLE GREAT

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Cannon printer #2 It 's a great Product!

Great sales people in the Vernon Hills IL store!

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Compact Design; Easy To Set Up
I bougth another one for my shop after i got this one.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price, nice design, decent print quality
Cons: There is no USB cord in the box, you must provide your own. Fairly loud print device.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Cheaper than ink...I got this one on sale for a stupid low price.
Cons: Does not come with cord.
Hopefully Cannon keeps churning these out.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: Really easy to set up and an all round good quality printer

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:

Cons: noisy clattering sounds , but I can stand some noise .

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Canon PIXMA iP2702 4103B022 Black: Approx. 7.0 ipm Black Print Speed 4800 x 1200 dpi Color Print Quality InkJet Photo Color Printer w/ PP-201 Photo Paper

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review:
Pros: Cheap printer. Cant go wrong if you get this thing on sale. Now a day ink cost as much as a new printer.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Canon PIXMA IP2702 Ink Jet Printer
Item.Review: Good Points: Simple to install and use. Worked well right from the start. Bad Points: No delivery tray for output.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: Cannot beat the quality on this printer for this price. And the company shipped it super fast.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Canon PIXMA IP2702 Inkjet Printer, upto 4800X1200 DPI Photo Lab Quality prints

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: Will only use it for writing papers for now. But it also let you print pictures. It was highly recommended from comsumers report.

Item.Item: Canon PIXMA iP2702 Color Ink-jet printer - 7 ppm
Item.Review: Printer quit feeding paper in less than a month. There was no paper jam. To Canons' credit, they sent me a refurbished upgrade after 3 emails.

Free is good.
